Detailed Description

Class for discovering and unlocking radars attached to a network.

Member Function Documentation

static tMultiRadarClient* Navico::Protocol::tMultiRadarClient::GetInstance ( )
static

Use this method to create and get access to the single instance of this singleton.

int Navico::Protocol::tMultiRadarClient::Connect ( )

Connects to the network and starts this objects internal threads.

Once connected it will listen to the service broadcasts of other devices and build up a data-base of the devices and their supported services.

Returns
0 if successful, or one of the Protocol::eErrors (ClientErrors.h) enums if failed
bool Navico::Protocol::tMultiRadarClient::Disconnect ( )

Stop this objects threads and disconnect from network.

This performs a civilised shutdown by notifying the thread and waiting until it terminates.

Returns
False if the stop was unnecessary, true otherwise
void Navico::Protocol::tMultiRadarClient::AddRadarListObserver ( iRadarListObserver *  pObserver)

void Navico::Protocol::tMultiRadarClient::SetUnlockKeySupplier ( iUnlockKeySupplier *  pSupplier)

Provide an implementation of the 'iUnlockKeySupplier' class that can be used to get an unlock-key for a particular radar.

Any successful unlock-key provided will be retained/cached until the 'ClearUnlockKeys' method is called.

Parameters
pSupplierPointer to the new unlock-key supplier
int Navico::Protocol::tMultiRadarClient::SetUnlockKey ( const char *  pSerialNumber,
const uint8_t *  pUnlockKey,
unsigned  unlockKeySize 
)

Set the unlock-key to be used for unlocking the specified radar.

These cached unlock keys maybe removed by calling the 'ClearUnlockKeys' method. This method will also automatically initiate an unlock sequence with radar.

Parameters
pSerialNumberUnique identifier for the radar
pUnlockKeyPointer to the start of the unlock-key
unlockKeySizeSize of the unlock key
Returns
0 if the unlock-key was accepted, or an Protocol::eErrors value otherwise
void Navico::Protocol::tMultiRadarClient::ClearUnlockKeys ( )

Removes all cached unlock-keys.

Navico::Protocol::tMultiRadarClient::NavClassConst ( cDefaultUnlockPeriod  ,
uint32_t  ,
500   
)

Default/reasonable timeout period for the completion of an 'UnlockRadar' method call (see below)

int Navico::Protocol::tMultiRadarClient::UnlockRadar ( const char *  pSerialNumber,
uint32_t  wait_ms = 0 
)

Initiates, and optionally waits for the completion of, the process of unlocking a single radar.

It assumes the unlock-key has already been provided, or will be provided by an iUnlockKeySupplier.

Parameters
pSerialNumberUnique identifier for the radar (if this is NULL and wait_ms is 0, then a query will be broadcast to all radars for their lock-IDs)
wait_msMaximum number of milli-seconds to wait for the unlock to finish. If 'wait_ms' is zero the call is non-blocking and will return immediately (see 'AddUnlockStateObserver' for detection of when the operation finishes). Otherwise the method will block for up to the number of milli-seconds specified; 'cDefaultUnlockPeriod should be a reasonable default for this)
Returns
The lock-level (>= 0, 0 meaning its locked) if successful, otherwise one of the Protocol::eErrors enum values
int Navico::Protocol::tMultiRadarClient::UnlockRadar ( const char *  pSerialNumber,
const uint8_t *  pUnlockKey,
unsigned  unlockKeySize,
uint32_t  wait_ms = 0 
)

Initiates, and optionally waits for the completion of, the process of unlocking a single radar.

Parameters
pSerialNumberUnique identifier for the radar
pUnlockKeyPointer to the start of the unlock-key
unlockKeySizeSize of the unlock key
wait_msMaximum number of milli-seconds to wait for the unlock to finish. If 'wait_ms' is zero the call is non-blocking and will return immediately (see 'AddUnlockStateObserver' for detection of when the operation finishes). Otherwise the method will block for up to the number of milli-seconds specified; 'cDefaultUnlockPeriod should be a reasonable default for this)
Returns
The lock-level (>= 0, 0 meaning its locked) if successful, otherwise one of the Protocol::eErrors enum values
unsigned Navico::Protocol::tMultiRadarClient::GetRadars ( char  radars[][MAX_SERIALNUMBER_SIZE],
unsigned  maxRadars 
)

Fills 'radars' with a list of all the radars that have announced themselves on the network (see 'SendQuery' method).

As many radar serial-numbers as possible will be placed into 'radars'. By specifying a value of 0 for 'maxRadars' you may find out the number of radar serial-numbers available without actually getting any.

Parameters
radarsLocation in which to return the radar serial-numbers
maxRadarsThe maximum number of serial-numbers 'radars' is capable of holding
Returns
Total number of radars known about, not just the number added to 'radars'
int Navico::Protocol::tMultiRadarClient::GetLockID ( char  lockID[MAX_LOCKID_SIZE *2],
const char *  pSerialNumber 
)

Fills 'lockID' with the lock ID of the radar of specified serial number in ASCII.

Parameters
lockIDLocation in which to return the lock ID of the radar. It must be a character array of size of at least MAX_LOCKID_SIZE * 2.
pSerialNumberUnique identifier for the radar
Returns
Number of bytes in lockID, or 0 if the specified radar is not found.
void Navico::Protocol::tMultiRadarClient::ClearRadars ( )

Removes all existing radars from the list; you will need to invoke 'SendQuery' to recreate an up to date list of available radars.

bool Navico::Protocol::tMultiRadarClient::QueryRadars ( )

Broadcasts a query for all attached radars to announce their presence.

Returns
True if the send was successfully initiated
int Navico::Protocol::tMultiRadarClient::GetImageStreamCount ( const char *  pSerialNumber)

Gets the number of image-streams (virtual-radars) provided by the specified radar.

Parameters
pSerialNumberUnique identifier for the radar
Returns
The number of image-streams supported. 1 or greater if the method succeeds, or a Protocol::eErrors enum value otherwise
int Navico::Protocol::tMultiRadarClient::IsServiceSupported ( const char *  pSerialNumber,
eService  service,
unsigned  imageStream = 0 
)

Returns whether a particular service is provided by a particular virtual-radar instance.

Note by definition all image-streams should support the image service.

Parameters
pSerialNumberUnique identifier for the radar
serviceThe service to check support for
imageStreamThe stream to check support for the service on
Returns
1 if the service is supported, 0 if its not, or a Protocol::eErrors enum value otherwise.
bool Navico::Protocol::tMultiRadarClient::ResetDeviceIDs ( )

Broadcasts a command to force all radars to renegotiate their unique device IDs, the next time they are restarted or disconnected & reconnected to the ethernet.

Returns
True if the send was successfully initiated
